text: Toss up to two cards from under target base, machine, or blueprint. Then if it has no cards under it, blow it up.
This mook gets +1 for every mook in your trash.
operation: Operation Kill Kit (16) — Blow up target mook if its threat level is lower than the total threat level of this operation.

text: At the start of your turn, tuck the top card of your arsenal under this card. Then if this card has 2 or more cards under it, liquidate it and put those cards into your hand.
When this mook joins an operation, if you have a base, you can exchange up to two cards from your hand with that many cards from under one of your blueprints.
Your scientists get +2 for each card under this base.
operation: Operation Welcome to Earth (12) — Tuck one of your machines under one of your bases, mooks, or blueprints. If you have no machines, hire a token mook instead.

text: Exchange up to three cards from your hand with that many cards from under any of your blueprints. If you exchange no cards this way, draw a card.
Whenever this base is blown up or liquidated, draw a card.
operation: Operation Defrost Caveman (20) — Reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a mook. If it's unique, hire it. If not, hire it as a token mook. Bottom the rest.

text: As long as you have a machine, this mook gets +2 for each card in your hand.
Once per turn, whenever an enemy targets a player or mook while this mook is at home, you can change that target to another target of the same type.

Your mooks can't be stolen.

When you start operations, you can have target enemy mook at home join one of your operations.
When this mook onboards, reveal the top five cards of your arsenal. Put a mook from among them into your hand and bottom the rest.
When you fabricate this machine, target player tosses the top three cards of their arsenal.

Enemies can't target your other machines.

When this machine is blown up, you can tuck it under one of your mooks, blueprints, or bases. If you don't, draw a card.
When this mook onboards, draw a card.
operation: Operation Atomic Strength (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints.

text: If one of your bases would be blown up, you can liquidate this base instead. If you do, draw two cards.
Your operations cost 3 less.
This machine can act as an operative with threat level 8. (While it's an operative it counts as a mook)
When this mook onboards, you can bottom it. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a mook. Hire that mook, and bottom the rest.
Look at the top three cards of your arsenal. Hire one as a token mook, put one into your hand, and toss the last one.
When this mook onboards, each player draws a card.
operation: Operation Energy Drinks (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints. If the card you assembled with was a mook or scheme, draw a card.

text: Target mook gets -8 until end of turn.
When this mook onboards, toss up to one card from under any nonplayer target.
operation: Operation Exploit Labor (14) — Assemble one of your blueprints.

text: Whenever you draw a card, you can reveal your hand. If you have three or more cards in hand and none of them share a card type, draw a card.

Play this only when one of your unique mooks is blown up by an ability.

Blow up any nonplayer target. Draw a card.
Your other mooks get +3.
At the start of your turn, if Death Ray has 6 or more cards under it, you can toss them all. If you do, target player loses the game.
operation: Operation Test Fire (12) — Toss 2 cards from under Death Ray. If you do, blow up any nonplayer target.

text: Blow up target unique mook or target mook with threat level 9 or higher.
Mooks get -5 from poison until your next turn. Until then, you can't hire mooks that aren't immune to poison.

This machine can count toward one requirement of any type.

The first time you hire a mook that has a requirement during each turn, draw a card.

When you would assemble a blueprint, first you can look at the top 3 cards of your arsenal, tuck one of them under that blueprint, and bottom the rest. Then put a card from under that blueprint into your hand.

When this mook onboards, tuck the top two cards of your arsenal under it.

This mook gets +2 for each card under it.
Whenever you start one or more operations, if you have a machine, you can hire a token mook.

Discard or liquidate a mook as a cost.

Blow up target base, then draw a card.
As long as you have at least 2 mooks and a machine, you can play a second scheme each turn.
When an operation targets you or one of your bases, you can liquidate this machine to stop it. You can use this ability if this machine is facedown by discarding a card as a cost.

operation: Operation Dark Laboratory (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint of your choice in play. It's invincible. To assemble a blueprint, tuck the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: The first time you hire one or more token mooks each turn, you hire that many plus one instead.
factionFlavorText: Quickly, Igor, I need more victi-... test subj-... I need more willing participants!

text: You can play an extra scheme each turn.
Play this only when an enemy starts an operation. Stop that operation.

Play only when one of your mooks is targetted by an enemy operation.

Stop that operation, then reveal the top 5 cards of your arsenal. You can play a base from among those cards. Bottom the rest.
Once per turn, whenever another of your nontoken mooks is blown up, hire a token mook.
Whenever an enemy targets one of your mooks, you can change the target to this mook. If you do, it gets +2 until end of turn.
When this mook onboards, target mook gets -5 from embarassment until end of turn.
operation: Operation Inside Scoop (5) — Target mook loses all immunities until end of turn.

text: Immune to poison.
operation: Operation Onion Cloud (5) — Target mook gets -5 from poison until your next turn.

text: Whenever you would draw a card, you can liquidate this machine and a mook instead. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a unique mook. Hire the revealed mook, then bottom the rest.

When you draw this card, you can reveal it to hire it.

Whenever you fabricate a machine, look at the top two cards of your arsenal. Bottom any number of them, then put the rest on top in any order.

Play only when one of your operatives is blown up. Each operative on that operation gains Lone Operative until the operation resolves. (They have "this mook can perform operations by itself, regardless of threat level requirement")

When this mook onboards, tuck the top 2 cards of your arsenal under it.

Whenever you would draw a card, you can put a card from under this card into your hand instead.
The first time you would draw a card each turn, instead look at the top card of your arsenal. You can toss that card. Then draw a card.

When you fabricate this machine, you can fabricate an additional machine this turn. This machine can act as an operative with threat level 2. When it joins an operation this way, draw a card.(While it's an operative it counts as a mook)
You can fabricate an additional machine each turn. When you do, draw a card.
operation: Operation Let's Split Up (10) — Choose an enemy operation. Separate its operatives into two piles. Its owner chooses a pile and brings those mooks home.

text: Immune to poison, disease, and radiation.
If anything would be blown up by an ability, you can liquidate this machine instead.
Hire a mook from your hand, ignoring its requirements.

Steal target mook and tuck this card under it. It can't join operations and has no abilities as long as this card is under it.

Whenever its owner would draw a card, they can have you draw two cards instead. If they do, toss this card.
You can liquidate mooks instead of other card types to pay costs. When you do, hire a token mook.
Hire a token mook, then if you have 3 or fewer mooks, hire another one.
This mook has threat level 6 and cannot be blown up by schemes or operations. (Its threat level can't change.)
Whenever you draw one or more cards, target mook gets -2 until end of turn for each card you drew.
Play only when a player hires a mook from their hand. When that mook onboards, blow it up.
Whenever you complete an operation that targets another player, you can resolve it again with the same operatives.
operation: Operation View Count (9) — Target player reveals their hand. If they have three or more cards in hand, draw a card.

text: When this mook onboards, assemble one of your blueprints.

As long as this mook has any schemes under it, it has base threat level 10 and is a horror.

You can play schemes that are under this mook.
operation: Operation Test Sample (10) — Reveal the top card of your arsenal. If it's a scheme, put it under this mook.

text: Your blueprints can't be targeted by enemies.
operation: Operation Weapons Research (8) — Draw a card.

text:
Your scientists get +2.

Friendly abilities triggered by fabricating machines trigger twice.
operation: Operation Field Trip (18) — Blow up target base.

text: Blow up target machine or facedown card.
Your mooks are scientists.

You can fabricate this machine whenever you're targeted by an operation. If you do, stop that operation.

Operations can't target you unless they include at least one mook with threat level 4 or lower.
Requires 1 machine
operation: Operation Laser Level (20) — Blow up target base or machine.

text: Whenever you assemble a blueprint, you can use a card from your hand instead of the top card of your arsenal. If you do, draw a card.
Onboarding abilities of mooks you onboard trigger twice.
This mook gets +2 for each of your machines.

At the start of your turn, if Mind Control Device has 8 cards under it, you can toss them all. If you do, steal all of target enemy's mooks and that player loses the game.

Whenever you start an operation, you can toss 2 cards from under Mind Control Device. If you do, target enemy mook at home joins that operation.
Once per turn, when you hire a nontoken mook, hire a token mook.
Whenever an enemy operation resolves, if it didn't target you or any cards, you can discard a card to copy that operation. You can choose new targets for the copy.
Requires 4 or more schemes in your trash
operation: Operation Plan For Domination (12) — Reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a scheme. Put that card into your hand and bottom the rest.

text: This mook gets +2 for each of your other mooks.
operation: Operation Dine In (30) — Blow up target mook.

text: When this mook onboards, you can fabricate an additional machine this turn.

Operations can't target you or your bases unless they have 3 or fewer operatives.

Cards on the moon are invincible.
operation: Operation Moon Raker (11) — This operation must have exactly 3 operatives. Put any nonplayer target on the moon.

text:
When this mook onboards, take back everything that was stolen from you.

The first time this mook would be blown up by an ability, instead it becomes a cyborg with threat level 6.
Enemies can't target you or your stuff with operations that have total threat level 12 or less.
operation: Operation Catapult Launch (20) — Stop an operation with lower total threat level than this one.
Operation Doomsday Device (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint of your choice in play. It's invincible. To assemble a blueprint, tuck the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: Your operations cost 1 less for each of your machines.
factionFlavorText: My modification will increase the efficiency of the unilateral phase detractors by over three point seven two percent! I'll be unstoppable!

text:
Enemy mooks have +1 to each of their requirements.

Mooks without requirements can't join operations the turn they onboard.
Draw two cards. If you performed your faction action this turn, draw three cards instead.

When you fabricate this machine, draw a card.

Your mooks can't have their threat levels lowered by enemy cards.
You can fabricate an additional machine during each of your turns.
When this mook onboards, bottom your hand and draw that many cards. If you didn't draw any cards this way, tuck the top card of your arsenal under one of your blueprints.
Look at the top four cards of your arsenal. Put one of them into your hand, and bottom the rest. You can play another scheme this turn.

Requires 1 mook, 1 machine

At the end of your turn, any player can discard a card. If no one does, blow up target machine and draw a card.
Invincible

When this mook onboards, reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a machine. Put that machine into your hand or order it, then bottom the rest.

Whenever one of your machines would be blown up, you can liquidate another machine instead.
Play only when a player hires a mook from their hand. That mook onboards as a token mook. (It's facedown, nameless, and has threat level 5 and no abilities.)

Play only when an enemy plays a scheme.

You can choose new targets for that scheme. If it has no targets, you perform that scheme's actions instead.

Liquidate one of your machines as a cost.

Toss up to three cards from under any nonplayer target.

Requires 1 machine

Whenever an enemy starts an operation, you can blow up target operative from that operation with lower threat level than this mook.
Each player liquidates a mook, base, or machine.

Look at the top 5 cards of your arsenal. You can reveal a machine or a mook with threat level 5 or less. If you do, put it into your hand and bottom the rest. If you don't, you can bottom any of the cards and put the rest on top in any order.
Lone Operative (This mook can perform operations by itself, regardless of threat level requirement) When this mook onboards or comes home, toss a card from under any nonplayer target.

Play only when you or one of your bases are targeted for an operation.

Blow up each of its operatives that have threat level 5 or less, then draw a card.
Your schemes can't be stopped.
operation: Operation Esoteric Writing (12) — Liquidate a mook when you start this operation. When it resolves, reveal a scheme from your hand and use its effect for this operation (you don't have to pay its costs).

text:
You can look at facedown cards.

Whenever an enemy token mook onboards, you can flip it faceup.
operation: Operation Acid Wash (10) — Flip target mook facedown. It's a token mook.

text: Whenever one of your token mooks onboards, look at it. You can flip it faceup.
Target player liquidates their mooks with the lowest threat level.
Whenever you play a base or fabricate another machine, you can liquidate this machine. If you do, each player discards their hand and draws three cards.
When this mook onboards, steal target machine.
When you fabricate this machine, look at the top three cards of your arsenal. You can bottom any of them, then put the rest on top in any order.

Discard a card as a cost.

Draw three cards.

Requires 3 mooks

Once each turn, when one of your operations is completed successfully, resolve it again with the same operatives. You can choose new targets.
operation: Operation Cooperation (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints, then draw a card.
Operation Man of Tomorrow (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint of your choice in play. It's invincible. To assemble a blueprint, tuck the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: The first time a player targets you or your cards each turn, draw a card.
factionFlavorText: I will destroy the entire city, unless you pay me... one million dollars! No, one billion dollars!

text:
While this mook is an operative, your other operatives can't be targeted.

Whenever you perform your faction action, look at the top two cards of your arsenal. You can bottom any of them, then put the rest on top in any order.

Liquidate a machine as a cost.

Blow up target mook.
When this mook returns home, draw a card.
operation: Operation The Big One (20) — Tuck the top card of target player's arsenal under this mook. Until the end of your turn, you can play that card. If you don't, toss it from under this card.

text: Search your arsenal for up to three machines. Choose one of them in secret and order it. After you shuffle, put one of the remaining cards on top and bottom the rest.

Play only when an enemy's mooks return home.

Choose one of those mooks and send away the rest.
Steal target mook at home until your next turn, or until it's targeted by an enemy ability. As long as it's yours, it can't join operations and your other mooks can't be targeted.
Reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a base. Play that base and bottom the rest.
When this mook onboards, hire a token mook.
Whenever an enemy starts an operation, you can liquidate this machine. If you do, that operation's operatives get -4 until it ends.
When this mook onboards choose one: target player tosses the top three cards of their arsenal; or toss a card from under any nonplayer target.
Blow up target machine, then draw a card. Then discard a card if it wasn't your machine.

At the start of your turn, if Unstoppable Giant Robot has 6 or more cards under it, you can toss them all. If you do, it becomes a mook with threat level 24.

Operations this mook joins can't be stopped.

When this mook successfully completes an operation that targets an enemy or their stuff, that player loses the game.

Immune to scientists and embarassment.

Mooks get -2 from disease.

When this mook onboards, tuck the top card of your arsenal under it.

Whenever one of your mooks would be blown up by an ability, you can toss a card from under this card instead.
operation: Operation Strong Silent Type (14) — Tuck the top card of your arsenal under this card.

text: Whenever an enemy operation targets you, if this mook is at home, you can liquidate it to stop that operation and blow up one of its operatives.
When this mook onboards, blow up every mook. Until end of turn, whenever a mook onboards, it's blown up by radiation.
Whenever you discard a card, bottom it instead of putting it into your trash.
operation: Operation It Belongs in a Museum (10) — Look at the bottom three cards of your arsenal. Put one into your hand and put the rest back.

text: Operations you start this turn can't be stopped.
